column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 95 of 124”
Table: 87
Capital Improvement Plan
Contingency List
DESCRIPTION
Replacement of the existing wood jetty located approximately
600 feet north of the Salt Ponds Channel Inlet. The jetty,
which was built in the 1960's, suffered damage and is in need
of replacement.
TOTAL: Hampton's Waterways

column1: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support
column2: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support

column3: Reconstruct Air Power Park to include a new exhibit building,
elevated plan pedestals, raising the grade of the park due to

column1: Air Power Park Reconstruction Parks & Recreation
column2: Air Power Park Reconstruction Parks & Recreation

column3: flooding, constructing new sidewalks and adding park
amenities.
Construct Armistead Point Park Community Center and
Cultural Facility.
Upgrade lighting systems at Hampton-Newport News
Community Service Building; Eaton, Lindsay and Spratley
Middle Schools and Asbury and Bryan Elementary Schools.
Install lighting systems at schools and park sites with no
lights.
Sewer and electrical problems are being encountered as well
as broken water lines. The buildings, fences and other
structures all need repair/replacement to ensure a quality
experience and safety for visitors, employees and the
animals. Visitor Center needs to be added for a point of
contact for visitors to gain information, report accidents and
have a central restroom location with upgraded facilities and
additional parking.
Re-design Briarfield Park in response to a growing demand
for lighted ball fields and to accommodate the increased
participation of youth baseball organizations. The redesign
would also allow the City to host regional and national
tournaments.
